Few weeks back, I found someone who got recently 𝗹𝗮𝗶𝗱 𝗼𝗳𝗳 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗻𝘆.

How many of you agree that 𝗝𝗼𝗯 𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 can be a difficult process?

He reached out to many recruiters regarding hiring opportunities.

He posted on LinkedIn but none of the recruiter responded him neither anyone thought of - “𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝗯𝗲𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗵”.

I went to his post, engaged it and referred his CV to few of my fellow recruiter friends.

Yesterday, he sent me a request and posted -

𝗛𝗲 𝗳𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗴𝗼𝘁 𝗵𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗳𝗮𝗰𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗺𝗮𝗻𝘆 𝗿𝗲𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗲𝘀.

𝗜𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗼𝘀𝘁 / 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘀 :-

Make the proper use of social media, networking and your LinkedIn platform.

If you help others,
you’ll start getting help from others too.

postsData.name:
Rachel Park
Rachel Park
postsData.content:
Stop Planning Luxury Vacations to Fix Your Burnout

7 Priceless Gifts You Can Give Yourself 
(And Why They Matter)

You often celebrate achievements and material success.

But lasting joy isn't found in external things.
Your heart already knows what really matters.

Here are 7 priceless gifts you can give yourself—and why they matter 

1. The Gift of Self-Compassion:
→ Burnout brings harsh self-criticism, but kindness in self-talk supports healing.
→ When negative self-talk arises, reframe it kindly.

2. The Gift of Alignment:
→ Burnout isn’t always from doing too much; reflecting on values realigns your actions.
→ List activities that energize you and add one to your week.

3. The Gift of Boundaries:
→ Boundaries protect your time and energy, helping prevent burnout and exhaustion.
→ Identify one area where you feel stretched and set a clear limit.

4. The Gift of Mindful Presence:
→ You don’t need to escape; small, mindful moments can deeply ground you.
→ Fully engage in one daily activity without distractions.

5. The Gift of Rest (Without Guilt):
→ You don’t need productivity to earn rest; take guilt-free downtime to recharge.
→ Schedule short breaks into your day to pause and reset.

6. The Gift of Support:
→ You’re not meant to carry everything alone; seeking help is a strength, not a weakness.
→ Reach out to someone you trust today to share your feelings.

7. The Gift of Saying No:
→ Every “no” to draining tasks is a “yes” to well-being.
→ Start by declining a non-essential meeting.


Luxury isn't about where you escape to.

It's about creating a life you don't need to escape from.

What gift will you give yourself this week? Share below 


 If you enjoyed this content, you might like my newsletter here:

____


 Follow mefor more posts on career & wellbeing.
️ Repost to support your network.

comments.commentText: True luxury is creating balance through self-compassion, boundaries, and mindful breaks. I’ve also found that disconnecting from digital devices daily helps regain clarity. Thank you for sharing,.
comments.userName: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor

postsData.commentAdded: What a powerful reminder! Self-compassion and setting boundaries are key. Excited to try infusing more mindful moments into my week! 🌟

postsData.content:
I'm going to ask you to attend one of our events in 2025.

And if you say no, I am going to ask why, and I will write down that reason.

Because we want you come.
And they are awesome.

Because your tribe will matter for you in 2025 more than you realize and I want to GIVE as much resource and capability to you as I possibly can.

Are the people around you capable.
Are the people around you having the conversations that fuel you.
Are the people around adding to you or taking away from you.
Are the people around you complaining or solving.
Are the people around you evolving or slowing you down.
Are the people around you sharing or costing you.
Are the people around you challenging you to get better.
Are the people around you in healthy or toxic relationships?

Improve your mental mindset
Improve your physical capability
Get better at digital security
Make more money
BUILT DIFFERENT

postsData.name:
Fatou Seck Mathon
Fatou Seck Mathon
postsData.content:
Losing your job doesn’t make you worthless. 

A layoff, a toxic workplace, or a big failure shakes your self-confidence.

You question yourself, doubting your abilities and feeling stuck.

I have been there.

But confidence isn't something you wait to feel again.

Take these actions to rebuild it, one step at a time.

 Reframe the setback.
↳ This wasn't the end of your story; it's part of your growth.
↳ Write down 3 lessons you've learned from this experience.

 Change the narrative in your head.
↳ Catch yourself when self-doubt creeps in.
↳ Replace negative with positive self-talk.

 Reconnect with what makes you feel strong.
↳ What activity used to bring you joy? Start doing it again.
↳ Small wins build momentum; celebrate them.

 Surround yourself with the right people.
↳ Spend time with those who uplift you.
↳ Distance yourself from those who feed your doubts.

 Take action before you feel ready.
↳ Confidence follows action, not the other way around.
↳ Start small, send that email, make that call, and take that step.

Confidence isn't about never falling.

It's about knowing you can rise again.

What's one thing you do daily to protect your self-confidence?

Repost to help someone rebuild their confidence.
Followfor more.

comments.commentText: Love this Fatou Seck. Losing a job is just a detour in the path to your next chapter.
comments.userName: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Reframing setbacks is key. I always remind myself that every challenge is a stepping stone to growth. Thank you for sharing!

postsData.content:
Say goodbye to never-ending job searches!

ChatGPT can help you land your dream job twice as fast.

Here are 9 impactful ChatGPT prompts will 10X your interview chances.

1. Tailoring Your Resume:

ChatGPT Prompt: "Could you modify my resume to align with the [Job Title] role at [Company]? Refer to the job description [Paste Job Description] and my resume [Paste Resume]."

2. Crafting a Professional Summary:

ChatGPT Prompt: "Based on my resume, create a professional summary tailored to the [Job Title]. [Paste Resume]"

3. Decoding Job Descriptions:

ChatGPT Prompt: "Enumerate the primary responsibilities for [Job Title]. List the top three requirements from the job description [Paste Job Description]."

4. Enhancing Resume Bullets:

ChatGPT Prompt: "Revise this resume bullet point using clear and impactful language, emphasizing my accomplishments. [Paste Resume]"

5. LinkedIn Summary Creation:

ChatGPT Prompt: "Compose a LinkedIn summary using details from my resume [Paste Resume]."

6. Job Applications with ChatGPT:

ChatGPT Prompt: "Identify my [Skills] expertise from my resume [Paste Resume]. Describe it conversationally and clearly, as if I were speaking."

7. Personalized Cover Letter:

ChatGPT Prompt: "Draft a personalized cover letter for the [Job Title] position at [Company]. Include the job description [Paste Job Description] and my current resume [Paste Resume]."

8. Interview Preparation:

ChatGPT Prompt: "What skills and experiences should I emphasize during an interview for the [Job Title] role in [Specific Industry]?"

9. Common Interview Questions:

ChatGPT Prompt: "List the top 10 questions commonly asked during interviews for a(n) [Job Title] position.

postsData.name:
Marianna Outsia
Marianna Outsia
postsData.content:
What Happens When You Stop Controlling Everything?
For the longest time, I believed that being in control 
was the key to success. But in 2024, I learned something 

unexpected:

control can sometimes hold you back.


We like to think we’re in charge of everything…

our plans,

our performance,

even the outcomes.


But the truth?

Most of life is beyond our control.

Holding on too tightly can create stress,

doubt,

and overwhelm.


Here’s the shift that changed everything for me:

instead of trying to control every little detail,

I chose to trust the process.

It wasn’t easy at first,

but once I surrendered the need to micromanage,

I found clarity.


By letting go,

I started to focus on what truly matters:

showing up, being consistent,

and embracing the moment.

Ironically, this approach brought more discipline,

better performance, and deeper satisfaction.


Sometimes, the best thing you can do

is to let go of the illusion of control

and trust yourself to navigate the chaos.


How do you approach life’s unpredictability?

comments.commentText: That's so correct. Love it

postsData.commentAdded: Such a powerful reminder! Embracing uncertainty often leads to growth and clarity. Trusting the process really can transform our journey!

postsData.name:
Blessing Ikpia
Blessing Ikpia
postsData.content:
Sadly, You keep leaving money on the table.

MARKETING 101 for Tech and AI brands

Your AI is powerful but your marketing is leaving money on the table

Guess what?

Nobody cares about your AI model.

Harsh? I'm sorry (okay, I'm not)
True? Absolutely (that's why you've not met your sales target)

AI & tech brands make this mistake all the time, obsessing over features instead of customers PAIN POINT.

I see startups bragging about their “advanced deep learning algorithms” or “cutting-edge blockchain security.”

It's cool, but who cares?

Your audience doesn’t wake up thinking, Wow, I need a new AI algorithm today

They wake up thinking:
 “How can I automate this repetitive task?”

 “How do I protect my business from cyber threats?”

 “How do I get insights without hiring a data team?”

Your tech isn’t the selling point. The TRANSFORMATION IT CREATES is, how it solves their problem.

 “We use AI-powered automation.”
 “Save 10+ hours a week by automating your workflows without typing a single line of code”

 “Our security tool is blockchain-based.”
 “Prevent cyber attacks before your company's data get stolen.”

See the difference? One talks tech. The other talks value.

Marketing isn’t about sounding smart. It’s about making your audience feel seen, understood and confident that you have the solution to their problem.

So, tell me ... does your marketing speak tech jargon or human impact?

Let’s talk in the comments.

I'm, a Growth Marketer. I share my professional journey to empower young Marketers, I also share resources like courses, mentorship programs, job vacancies for entry level professionals seeking global opportunities.

If this resonates with you, ensure you followfor more

comments.commentText: When I started in tech in 2015, everytime I was starting in a company I was always starting by "ok what are the pains of our customers because when i look at our website I don't get anything except how powerful are our algorithms". The lack of customer centric approach is real in tech brands!

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Focusing on customer pain points is key. Let’s shift the narrative from tech specs to transformative impact! #MarketingMatters

postsData.content:
Social Well-Being

I have come across many people whose social well-being has been impacted due to relocating to a new place and feeling isolated because of cultural or value mismatches.

Here are my tips to boost social well-being:

1)Find Your Tribe:
No matter where you are, living as part of a community gives you strength. Find your tribe.

2)Maintain Boundaries:
While I encourage connections, maintaining boundaries with people is extremely important to avoid potential harm to relationships.

3)Make Space for Your Well-Being:
Every day—or at least three days a week—it is non-negotiable to prioritize your physical, mental, and emotional well-being

4) Have regular connect with your family and friends atleast through online platforms

Hope this helps

Hey I am Divya, a Psychology Counselor. Follow my whatsapp for many personal growth insights

postsData.name:
Michael Kainatsky
Michael Kainatsky
postsData.content:
There are a few dates in my life that I will never forget. 


January 26, 2020 is one of them.

It's one of those things where you'll always ask "where were you when?"

My wife and I were in Hawaii on our baby moon.

She was 4 months pregnant, we were on top of the world.

She woke me up in a frenzy and said there was some crazy fake news
swirling around.

A death hoax for Kobe, and that he had died in a helicopter crash.

There was no way I was going to believe that one of my childhood idols had not only died,

but so tragically, too.

For an hour, I searched every single news outlet I could praying for someone to disprove it.

To find out it was true, and that his daughter and several other
families were on board too,

just crushed me.

A quick back story. . .

Shortly after I arrived in the U.S. in 1988, I fell in love with the
game of basketball.

A few years after that in 1990, I fell in love with Michael Jordan.

Not long after that, in 1993, my heart was broken by his extremely
premature retirement.

My 2nd heartbreak came when he retired again in 1998,

but this time I had a backup; Kobe.

To me, he embodied all that I had grown to idolize about MJ and my infatuation grew fast . .

because I missed MJ so much.

I played and watched basketball for 26 years because of MJ and then, Kobe.

My third and final basketball heartbreak came when Kobe died.

I dont think it was just because of him dying, but also,

the realization that my childhood, was now completely gone.

Since that day, I've not watched a single basketball game.

It's still very difficult to believe he's not here because of how much he's been immortalized.

This goes beyond a game, but his entire existence as the human being he was,

what he did for people, and what he represents to this day to so many.

There's just certain things that you never get over,

that will never leave you, and this is one of them for me.

My heart continues to go out to The Bryant family and the families of those that lost their loved ones that day.

Continue to Rest in Power, Mamba, I will always miss you.

With much love and respect,

comments.commentText: No words.

Back in the early 00s my ex-business partner got a call from someone claiming to be Kobe Bryant. 

He thought it was just someone pranking him. But it turned out it was Kobe. Kobe had read his book and wanted to hire him.

Ended up working on some stuff for Kobe and the Lakers.

Something interesting from that time that I haven't seen mentioned often:

Kobe was transitioning jerseys from number 8 to number 24.

It wasn't just a number change for him.
It was a mentality change.
It had personal significance.

24 meant dedicating himself every hour of the day to being a better person so that others could look up to him.

It meant going from focusing only on himself and his celebrity to focusing on being a leader and helping his teammates reach goals.

Kobe realized that leadership is a choice and that it takes dedication, practice, awareness, constant learning, and skill.

That was the impetus for the number change.
Aaron that is amazing story and I never knew why he chose 24. I always assumed it was not to be in Michael’s shadow and 1 up the nhmber. Incredible.

postsData.commentAdded: Thank you for sharing your heartfelt memories. Kobes impact transcended the game, leaving an indelible mark on all of us. 🏀❤️

postsData.name:
Nirmal Patel
Nirmal Patel
postsData.content:
The closure of Hindenburg Research, led by founder Nate Anderson, sheds light on the challenges activist short sellers face in today's financial markets. While Hindenburg exits the stage, other key players in the field persevere:

- Muddy Waters Research, founded by Carson Block, remains vigilant in uncovering corporate frauds.
- ShadowFall, under Matthew Earl's guidance, focuses on European mid-cap companies, scrutinizing potential overvaluations and misconduct.
- Quintessential Capital Management, led by Gabriel Grego, persists in targeting suspected fraudulent activities through activist short selling.
- Hunterbrook stands out for its innovative approach, blending investigative journalism with hedge fund strategies to reveal corporate malfeasance.

These firms continue their short-selling endeavors despite mounting obstacles like increased litigation and regulatory scrutiny. Hindenburg's departure underscores the sector's challenges, emphasizing the resilience necessary for activist short sellers to navigate this evolving landscape.

comments.commentText: Determination and persistence are key traits for firms operating under heightened scrutiny.

postsData.commentAdded: An insightful reflection on the resilience within activist short selling! Excited to see how these firms adapt and continue their crucial work. #Finance

We had an incredible time at our recent roundtable discussion on the future of Learning & Development (L&D)! The session brought together industry leaders, L&D professionals, and innovators to exchange insights on the latest trends, challenges, and opportunities shaping workforce learning.

Key Takeaways from the Discussion:

 The growing role of AI and digital learning in personalized training
 Upskilling and reskilling as a strategic priority for organizations
 The shift towards a learner-centric approach to drive engagement
 Measuring L&D impact with data-driven strategies
 The importance of leadership buy-in for a strong learning culture

A huge thank you to our esteemed panelists and engaged participants for their valuable contributions. Let’s continue shaping the future of L&D together!

postsData.name:
Mario Hernandez
Mario Hernandez
postsData.content:
Nonprofits Need to Increase Their Luck Surface Area:


Most nonprofits don’t fail because they don’t care enough.

They fail because they rely on hope instead of systems.

They wait for the “right donor” to show up.

They chase the “perfect grant” that takes months to secure.

They bank on a “viral moment” to suddenly change their fate.

That’s not how luck works.

Luck isn’t magic. It’s math.

The bigger your luck surface area, the more opportunities you attract.

Here’s how nonprofits can stack the odds in their favor:

1. Stop Being a Best-Kept Secret

Most nonprofits talk to the same tight-knit circle:

Existing donors, impact reports, and industry conferences.

Your future supporters aren’t in those rooms.

Get loud. Be where attention already exists:

→ Twitter threads about your boldest insights.
→ LinkedIn posts that challenge the status quo.
→ Podcasts where your mission reaches fresh ears.

More visibility = More serendipity.

2. Build a Magnet, Not a Megaphone:

Most fundraising feels like pushing cold outreach, grant chasing, begging.

Instead, build assets that make support come to you:

A newsletter that shares high-value insights, not just impact reports.

A founder who writes publicly about lessons learned.

A community where supporters feel involved, not just asked.

Inbound > Outbound. Every time.

3. Make Non-Traditional Asks:

Most nonprofits ask for donations. But money isn’t the only fuel.

Ask for:

Distribution (Who can amplify your message?)

Tech Partnerships (What tools can 10x your efficiency?)

Corporate Integrations (How can companies bake giving into their model?)

Funding follows momentum. Create it first.

4. Adopt a Startup Mindset

Successful startups don’t just raise money. They scale.

They A/B test messaging.

They automate donor follow-ups.

They iterate based on real feedback.

Nonprofits? Many still send PDFs and cross their fingers.

Innovation isn’t a luxury. It’s survival.

5. Become Undeniable

The best way to increase your luck?
Be so good they can’t ignore you.

Nail your messaging

Show radical transparency

Create something that demands to be shared

Luck isn’t about waiting. It’s about working the system.

Build it. Expand it. Watch what happens.

With purpose and impact,

comments.commentText: How many non profits have a really good chief revenue officer?
Michael Kainatsky not enough my friend
Mario I’m available. To put the fun back into fundraising.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Nonprofits can truly thrive by shifting from hope to strategy, amplifying their voice, and fostering genuine connections. #LuckSurfaceArea

Chitra Lele—Spirit-Tech Synergist
Chitra Lele—Spirit-Tech Synergist
postsData.content:
Jasmines are mine! by ©®Chitra Lele—Spirit-Tech Synergist (from my award-winning book Mother Nature's Miracles)

Dedicated to You All!

Oh jasmines, pretty jasmines!
Jasmines are mine
And yours.
They bring us charm that lasts for years.

Sweet scent of jasmines
Flowing through their tiny ivory trumpets,
Makes me swirl on cloud nine,
Where I find my cloister of nuggets.

The lucent cluster of lobes
Look like stars painted on the gossamer
Wrapped around our globe.
Such is the magic of these celestial charmers!

Jasmine flowers are waxy yellow white
And invite fairies in fancy gowns.
As they glow in the night,
They take away all the frowns.

Curtain upon curtain of aroma
And streamer upon streamer of glory,
Detox layer upon layer of trauma.
This is Mother Nature’s healing therapy.

Deep in the roots of my soul, I will cherish
This gift from God forever.
Its ethereal presence will never perish
From the florets of my ether.

--by Chitra
postsData.commentAdded: What a beautiful tribute to natures wonders, Chitra! Your words truly capture the enchanting essence of jasmines and their healing power. 🌼✨

postsData.name:
AI - Artificial intelligence
AI - Artificial intelligence
postsData.content:
China has developed a robot dog to transport patients.

It can carry 40 kg, climb over obstacles, and navigate disaster zones or battlefields to save lives. Sounds great, right?

But let’s not ignore the risks. The same tech could easily be weaponized or used for surveillance. A tool for saving lives could just as easily become a tool for destruction.

Is this progress or a problem waiting to happen?

Follow mefor more tech stuff.

comments.commentText: Alarming …. From an individual who has had the unfortunate task to accompany elderly relatives to A&E many times, experiencing the discomfort I cannot for the life in me rejoice at the use of this technology carrying poorly people around in this inhuman fashion .wheres the dignity and compassion?

postsData.commentAdded: Incredible innovation! Its essential we balance tech advancements with ethical considerations to ensure they serve humanity positively.

postsData.name:
Katie Patterson
Katie Patterson
postsData.content:
Our Happy Medium team met today for our 1q meeting - during our quarterly meetings, we review successes from the previous quarter, where we are to budget for the current quarter, where our team is leading in technical expertise and driving profit for our clients.

Doing quarterly meetings and sharing about the business at this level has been a game changer for the company. The team is more engaged when they fully understand where we are as a company, and we celebrate our wins together and grow as a team where we need to be better.

Knowing our numbers has taken a lot of work to systematize things to be able to see daily, but we're so much stronger for it. We have done this for ourselves and find so much joy in doing it for clients.
postsData.commentAdded: Fantastic to see the impact of transparent communication! Celebrating wins and aligning as a team is key to driving success. Keep it up!

postsData.name:
Garett Moreau 🇺🇸
Garett Moreau 🇺🇸
postsData.content:
“She sounded like a real engineer, the connection was super clear, and she had an American accent,” the developer said.

Scammers managed to call a victim using Google’s phone number (which is listed on the official support website) and then send an email from an official subdomain.

A software engineer recorded a conversation when he was sure this was a phishing attempt.

“The thing that's crazy is that if I followed the two ‘best practices’ of verifying the phone number + getting them to send an email to you from a legit domain, I would have been compromised,” Latta warns.

Google has not yet publicly addressed this specific issue.

comments.commentText: Very informative, Garett. Thank you.

postsData.commentAdded: This highlights the importance of vigilance in our digital interactions. Always double-check before sharing any personal info! 🔍 #Cybersecurity

postsData.name:
Lee Chang
Lee Chang
postsData.content:
Utah Tech Week featured over 200 great events, but Ruck hosted the only blue-collar, construction tech event. I want to blast out a reminder:

1) This is a $1.6 *trillion* industry just in the USA.

2) Fax machines and carbon copy receipts are still used in this industry

3) The age of top decision makers for the industry is about to drop from an average of 63 years old to 42 years old.

The panel was amazing. We were the only panel in the entire week to feature professionals with blood blistered hands and mud flecked boots - professionals that make millions a year.

You can follow hype, buzz, trends, or you can target dirty, unsexy jobs that require you to truly “think different”.

See you guys next year.

(Finally, photos uploaded after the THIRD TIME)

comments.commentText:
As someone who’s literally about to install a toilet and do some “hard work” 

then going to jump back on the computer and work more on the “difficult” work … I have seen the administrative challenges of the remodel/ construction industry first hand.

Tons of room for:
• VAs Specifically for Construction
• AI Agents that handle email
• Better Dispatching Apps that remove the financial side and keep that “in office”
• receptionist agents that link directly to existing dispatching apps
• AI Assisted Job Costing

the list goes on… the clerical work load is “heavy” in the construction industry (pun intended) and doing paperwork is THAT much more exhausting when you’re wiped out after busting ass all day

Love this post bro

postsData.commentAdded: Incredible insights! Excited to see the construction tech industry evolve as new leaders step in. Here’s to embracing the ‘unsexy’ jobs! 🚧💪

postsData.name:
Ford Coleman
Ford Coleman
postsData.content:
8 Hidden Skills That Catch a Leader's Eye
(The talents they notice but never tell you about!)

Smart leaders spot talent in unexpected places.

Here's the truth:
They watch for skills most people don't even know matter.

These quiet talents speak louder than any resume.

Here are 8 silent skills that make leaders pick you from the pack:

1️⃣ Make It Simple
↳ What they spot: You make complex issues sound simple.
↳ Why it matters: You can turn chaos into clarity.

2️⃣ Read The Room
↳ What they spot: You feel the room's energy instantly.
↳ Why it matters: You prevent fires before they start.

3️⃣ Catch The Small Stuff
↳ What they spot: You catch tiny things others miss.
↳ Why it matters: You stop small problems from growing big.

4️⃣ Connect The Dots
↳ What they spot: You connect people who should know each other.
↳ Why it matters: You make teams stronger naturally.

5️⃣ Fix It Quietly
↳ What they spot: Things work better when you're around.
↳ Why it matters: You solve problems without drama.

6️⃣ See It Coming
↳ What they spot: You plan for tomorrow's problems today.
↳ Why it matters: You help dodge bullets before they're fired.

7️⃣ Keep The Secret
↳ What they spot: People naturally tell you the real story.
↳ Why it matters: You know what's really going on.

8️⃣ Guard The Vibe
↳ What they spot: You protect team spirit without trying.
↳ Why it matters: You make good teams great.

Remember:
These skills can't be faked, they show up in how you work every day.

Leaders notice more than you think.

Which skill do you naturally have?
Let me know in the comments below ⬇

 Repost if you found this helpful!
 Followfor more!

postsData.name:
Chase Dimond
Chase Dimond
postsData.content:
Hiring a person can be life-changing for them.

I once gave a job to a person from Africa. 

The job was nothing special. It had average pay. Normal work conditions. A basic desk and swivel chair.

But to them it was a huge deal.

They used their salary to help migrate the rest of their family to Australia. They sent money to their elders back home. They bought their first car.

And the newfound confidence helped them become a leader at their church.

Never underestimate giving someone an opportunity. There are so many ripple effects that occur. You can literally change the trajectory of entire community.

An amazing post by(go follow him)

PS. Take care of your team members. Helping one person - you are creating a ripple effect. Let that sink in.

comments.commentText: absolutely! a small opportunity can spark massive change

postsData.commentAdded: What a powerful reminder of the impact a single opportunity can have! Truly inspiring to see how meaningful change can ripple through communities. 🌍✨

postsData.name:
Palak Goel
Palak Goel
postsData.content:
"Gloves Down, Legacy Intact. Wriddhiman Saha Bids Farewell to Cricket" 

In an era dominated by aggressive batters and flamboyant stroke play, Wriddhiman Saha quietly built a legacy rooted in resilience, precision, and sheer commitment. His retirement marks the end of an era for Indian cricket, especially in the art of wicketkeeping 

The Ultimate Team Man 

Saha was never the loudest on the field, but his glovework spoke volumes. Whether it was diving full-stretch to pouch an edge or standing up to spinners on raging turners, he set the gold standard for wicketkeeping in India. His impeccable technique made him one of the finest glovesmen of his time

 40 Tests, 104 catches, 12 stumpings – India’s go-to wicketkeeper post-MS Dhoni in red-ball cricket.
 The first Indian wicketkeeper to score a Test century overseas (2017 vs WI).
 Part of historic victories – From Australia to South Africa, his contributions behind the stumps were invaluable.

A Century in an IPL Final – The Underrated Batter 

While known for his wicketkeeping, Saha had his moments with the bat, too. His unbeaten 115 in the 2014 IPL final remains one of the finest innings in the tournament’s history, showcasing his ability to step up on the grandest stage 

▪️Over 4,000 first-class runs at an average of 48.68 – A testament to his batting prowess.
▪️Grit & Reliability – Always willing to fight it out when the team needed him the most.

A Legacy of Dedication 

From donning the gloves for Bengal to being India’s go-to wicketkeeper in Test cricket, Saha’s career is a reminder that not all heroes need the spotlight. He was the silent force behind many memorable wins, ensuring India’s bowling attack always had a safe pair of hands behind the stumps

As he bids farewell to professional cricket, one thing is certain—Indian cricket was richer with Wriddhiman Saha behind the stumps

 What’s your favorite memory of Saha? Let’s celebrate a true servant of the game ️

Defines Saha completely! To come in after MS was never going to be easy. But he did a fabulous job!

postsData.name:
Ryan Yockey
Ryan Yockey
postsData.content:
9 Brutal Truths Your Boss Won’t Tell You

(But you need to hear them to grow)

1️⃣ Your Effort Doesn’t Always Equal Recognition
→ Hard work is important, but it doesn’t guarantee visibility. You need to advocate for yourself if you want to be noticed.

2️⃣ No One Is Thinking About Your Career as Much as You
→ Your growth is your responsibility. Don’t expect your boss to map out your future—take control of it yourself.

3️⃣ Being Good at Your Job Isn’t Enough
→ Skills matter, but relationships are just as important. Networking and building connections will get you further than technical excellence alone.

4️⃣ Your Job Security Is Never Guaranteed
→ Even if you’re the best, external factors can impact your role. Always be ready for change—keep your resume updated and network active.

5️⃣ The Company’s Needs Come Before Your Needs
→ You are valuable, but the company is focused on the bottom line. Make decisions that prioritize your well-being.

6️⃣ You Won’t Always Get Direct Feedback
→ Sometimes your boss won’t tell you where you’re lacking. Seek out feedback intentionally, don’t wait for it to come to you.

7️⃣ If You Don’t Speak Up, You’ll Get Overlooked
→ Silence isn’t a strategy. Share your ideas, take initiative, and make sure people know your contributions.

8️⃣ Burnout Isn’t a Badge of Honor
→ Working yourself to exhaustion doesn’t impress anyone. Learn to set boundaries or the company will let you burn out without blinking.

9️⃣ Loyalty Is Only Valuable When You’re Delivering
→ Companies love loyalty, but only when you're performing. Make sure your loyalty is reciprocal—are you getting what you deserve in return?

Reality Check: Your boss may not tell you these things, but that doesn’t mean they aren’t true.

Take control of your career, advocate for yourself, and set your own boundaries.

What’s the hardest truth you’ve learned in your career?
----

️ Repost if these truths hit home
 Followfor more

comments.commentText: Ryan Yockey Very informative. Thanks for sharing

postsData.commentAdded: These truths are a great reminder to proactively shape our careers! What steps are you taking to advocate for your own growth? 🚀

postsData.name:
Nikhil Sharma
Nikhil Sharma
postsData.content:
Modern Code ≠ Maintainable Code
You create legacy code the moment you stop writing tests.

You can follow the most cutting-edge patterns and architectures, but without tests, the value of your code diminishes over time.

I've been working on a project that's been running strong since 2014. Every critical functionality is covered with tests, and that has made all the difference. The codebase is still a joy to work with because tests provide confidence and safety - not absolute safety, but like a tightrope walker with a harness, you feel secure making changes.

In contrast, I've seen a 2-year-old project that's an absolute nightmare to maintain. The difference? No tests.

Tests are like regular maintenance checks for your car. Every time you build and run tests, you're getting a pre-drive inspection. A brand-new car without maintenance won’t last long.

So next time someone dismisses an older codebase as "legacy" just based on its age, ask:

Is it well-maintained and solid like a classic vintage car?
Or is it shiny and new but fragile inside one step away from breaking down?

Write tests. Build longevity. Keep the engine running.
postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Tests are the backbone of sustainable code. They ensure longevity and maintainability, just like routine car maintenance. Keep coding smart!
